sen.j: 金子 堅太郎（かねこ けんたろう、1853年3月13日（嘉永6年2月4日 (旧暦)） - 1942年（昭和17年）5月16日）は、明治期の官僚・政治家。
sen.e: Kentaro KANEKO (March 13, 1853 - May 16, 1942) was a bureaucrat and a politician in the Meiji period.
Kentaro KANEKO (March 13, 1853 - May 16, 1942) was a bureaucrat and a politician in the Meiji period.
Kentaro KANEKO (March 13, 1853 - May 16, 1942) was a bureaucrat and a politician in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 司法大臣、農商務大臣、枢密顧問官を歴任した。
sen.e: He has served as the Minister of Justice, Minister of Agriculture and Commerce and privy councilor.
He served as the Minister of Justice, Minister of Agriculture and Commerce, and a member of privy councilor.
He served as the Minister of Justice, Minister of Agriculture and Commerce, and a member of privy councilor.

sen.j: 位階は従一位大勲位伯爵。
sen.e: His court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank) supreme order count.
His court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank), supreme order count.
His court rank was Juichii (Junior First Rank), supreme order count.

sen.j: 日本法律学校（現日本大学）初代校長、二松学舎専門学校（二松學舍大学）舎長。
sen.e: He was the first head of Nihon Law School (currenlty Nihon University) and a principal of Nishogakusha school (Nishogakusha University).
He was the first head of Nihon Law School (currenlty Nihon University) and a principal of Nishogakusha school (Nishogakusha University).
He was the first head of Nihon Law School (currenlty Nihon University) and a principal of Nishogakusha school (Nishogakusha University).

sen.j: 伊藤博文の側近として大日本帝国憲法の起草に参画する。
sen.e: As a close adviser of Hirobumi ITO, he took part in drafting the Constitution of the Empire of Japan.
As a close adviser of Hirobumi ITO, he took part in drafting the Constitution of the Empire of Japan.
As a close adviser of Hirobumi ITO, he took part in drafting the Constitution of the Empire of Japan.

sen.j: また、日露戦争においては、アメリカ合衆国に渡り日本の戦争遂行を有利にすべく外交交渉・外交工作を行った。
sen.e: Moreover, at Russo-Japanese War, he went to the United States of America and conducted diplomatic negotiations and maneuver to make the war for Japneses benefit.
Moreover, during Russo-Japanese War, he went to the United States of America for diplomatic negotiations and maneuvers to bring an end to the war in Japan's favor.
Moreover, during the Russo-Japanese War, he went to the United States of America to conduct diplomatic negotiations and enact strategies to bring an end to the war that would favor Japan.

sen.j: 日本法律学校（日本大学の前身）初代校長、また専修大学（当時の専修学校）創立に携わった大いなる協力者。
sen.e: He was the first head of Nihon Law School (currently Nihon University) and greatly contributed to the foundation of Senshu University (Senshu School at that time).
He was the first head of Nihon Law School (currently Nihon University) and greatly contributed to the foundation of Senshu University (Senshu School at that time).
He was the first head of Nihon Law School (currently Nihon University) and greatly contributed to the foundation of Senshu University (Senshu School at that time).

sen.j: 目賀田種太郎や相馬永胤と時を同じくアメリカに留学。
sen.e: He studied in America at same time Tanetaro MEGATA and Nagatane SOMA did.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He studied in the US around the same time as Tanetaro MEGATA and Nagatane SOMA did.
He studied in the US around the same time as Tanetaro MEGATA and Nagatane SOMA did.

sen.j: ハーバード大学法学部で法律を学び、帰国後、専修学校の立案・運営に深く参画した。
sen.e: He learned law at Harvard Law School and was deeply involved in planning and administration of Senshu School after he returned to Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He learned law at Harvard Law School, and he got deeply involved in founding and running Senshu School after returning to Japan.
He learned law at Harvard Law School, and he got deeply involved in founding and running Senshu School after returning to Japan.

sen.j: その後、日米友好のために尽力して、晩年には太平洋戦争を憂慮していた。
sen.e: Afterwards, he made an effort for Japan-U.S. friendship and concerned about the Pacific Wars in his later years.
Afterwards, he devoted himself to promoting Japan-U.S. friendship, and, in his later years, he deeply concerned about the Pacific Wars.
Afterwards, he devoted himself to promoting Japan-U.S. friendship, and, in his later years, he deeply concerned about the Pacific Wars.

sen.j: ハーバード時代に上院議員チャールズ・サムナーの発言からエドマンド・バークの存在を知る。
sen.e: He heard about Edmund Burke from the speech of Senator Charles Sumner when he was at Harvard.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He heard about Edmund Burke in remarks of Senator Charles Sumner when he was at Harvard.
He heard about Edmund Burke in remarks of Senator Charles Sumner when he was at Harvard.

sen.j: のちにバークの本邦初訳である『政治論略』を刊行する。
sen.e: Later he translated and published "Seijigairon," which was the first Burke's book translated in Japanese.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。政治論略;原題不明
sen.e: Later he translated and published "Seijigairon," the first Japanese translation of Burke's book.
Later he translated and published "Seijigairon," the first Japanese translation of Burke's book.

sen.j: 北海道の開拓に関する建白書を政府に建議した際、網走集治監（網走刑務所）の囚人（思想犯多数）を開拓や道路建設に従事させるように提案。
sen.e: He made representations to the state about reclamation of Hokkaido, proposing to let the prisoners of the Abashiri prison engage in reclamation and road constructions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He submitted the government a petition about reclamation of Hokkaido, proposing to engage the prisoners of the Abashiri prison in reclamation and road construction works.
He submitted the government a petition about reclamation of Hokkaido, proposing to engage the prisoners of the Abashiri prison in reclamation and road construction works.

sen.j: 囚人の死を監獄費支出の減少として奨励させた。
sen.e: He also encouraged letting the prisoners die to save the prison expense.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This proposal was put into practice based on the concept that deaths of prisoners help reduce expenses of the prison.
This proposal was put into practice based on the concept that deaths of prisoners help reduce expenses of the prison.

sen.j: その結果、数多くの囚人が悲惨極まる強制労働にて死亡した。
sen.e: As a result, many prisoners died of the extreme forced labor.
As a result, many prisoners were forced to work in cruelly harsh conditions and died.
As a result, many prisoners were forced to work in cruelly harsh conditions and died.

sen.j: また、後に北海道で行われるタコ部屋労働の遠因となった。
sen.e: Moreover, became a remote cause of abusive labor practiced later in Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: タコ部屋労働:定訳不明
sen.e: This also indirectly lead to cruel works forced in Hokkaido in later years.
This also indirectly led to harsh forced physical labor in Hokkaido in later years.

sen.j: 1853年（嘉永6年）2月4日、福岡藩士勘定所附・金子清蔵直道の長男として、筑前国早良郡鳥飼村字四反田（現在の福岡市中央区鳥飼）に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born on Feburary 4, 1853, as the first son of Kiyozonaomichi KANEKO, who was a feudal retainer accountant of Chikuzen Province, in Aza Yontanda, Torikai Village, Sawara County, Chikuzen Province (present-day Toorikai, Chuo Ward Fukuoka City).
sen.cmt: 勘定所附:訳不明清蔵直道:読み不明
sen.e: He was born on February 4, 1853, in Aza Yontanda, Torikai Village, Sawara County, Chikuzen Province (present-day Toorikai, Chuo Ward Fukuoka City), as the first son of Kiyozonaomichi KANEKO, a feudal retainer and accountant of kanjosho (finance ministry).

He was born on February 4, 1853, in Aza Yontanda, Torikai Village, Sawara County, Chikuzen Province (present-day Toorikai, Chuo Ward Fukuoka City), as the first son of Kiyozonaomichi KANEKO, a feudal retainer and accountant of kanjosho (finance ministry).

sen.j: 幼名は徳太郎。
sen.e: His childhood name was Tokutaro.
His childhood name was Tokutaro.
His childhood name was Tokutaro.

sen.j: 1860年(万延1年) 金山和蔵、次いで翌1861年(文久1年)、正木昌陽に師事。
sen.e: He studied under Kazuzo KANEYAMA in 1860, and Shoyo MASAKI in 1861.
He studied under Kazuzo KANEYAMA in 1860, and Shoyo MASAKI in 1861.
He studied under Kazuzo KANEYAMA in 1860, and Shoyo MASAKI in 1861.

sen.j: 漢学修行に入る。
sen.e: He started the study of the Chinese classics.
He started the study of the Chinese classics.
He started the study of the Chinese classics.

sen.j: 1863年（文久3年）1月、藩校修猷館に学ぶ。
sen.e: In January 1863, he studied at a hanko (domain school).
In January 1863, he started to study at Shuyukan, a han (domain) school established by a daimyo.
In January 1863, he started to study at Shuyukan, a han (domain) school established by a daimyo.

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）4月、父清蔵を亡くし、家督を相続する。
sen.e: In 1868, he lost his father Seizo and succeeded to the family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In April 1868, he lost his father Seizo and succeeded his father as the head of the family.
In April 1868, he lost his father Seizo and succeeded his father as the head of the family.

sen.j: 清蔵は1代限りの生涯士分であったため、士籍を失い銃手組に編入される。
sen.e: However, since Seizo's samurai status was one generation only, Kentaro was admitted into the gunner group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Since Seizo's samurai status was on a lifelong basis, Kentaro lost the status and was assigned to Jutegumi (military unit of gunners).
sen.cmt: 表現変更銃手組（定訳不明）に編入 は、銃手の部隊と考え訳してあります。
sen.e: Since Seizo's samurai status was on a lifelong basis, Kentaro lost the status and was assigned to Jutegumi (military unit of gunners).

sen.j: 鉄砲大頭役所使番、2月後に中番、次いで勘定所給仕となる。
sen.e: He became gunner 大頭役所 tsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield), 中番 two month later, and then kyuji (server) of kanjosho (finance ministry)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。大頭役所,中番,勘定所給仕:訳不明
sen.e: He became tsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield) of Jutegumi, and chuban two month later, and subsequently he was promoted to kyuji (server) of kanjosho (finance ministry).
sen.cmt: 表現変更大頭役所,中番,勘定所給仕:訳不明
sen.e: He became tsukaiban (a person responsible for order and patrol in the battlefield) of Jutegumi, and chuban two month later, and subsequently he was promoted to kyuji (server) of kanjosho (finance ministry).

sen.j: 銃手組の株を購入、4人扶持12石を得る。
sen.e: He purchased the stock of the gunner group and had four fuchi (stipend) and 12 goku crop yields.
He purchased the license for the head of Jutegumi and obtained four fuchi (stipends) and 12 goku crop yields.
He purchased the license for the head of Jutegumi and obtained four fuchi (stipends) and 12 goku crop yields.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）2月、修猷館での成績が優秀であることから永代士分に列せられ、秋月藩へ遊学を命ぜられる。
sen.e: In February 1869, because he was excellent at Shuyukan, he was raised to of permanent samurai status and was ordered to study in Akizuki Domain.
In February 1869, he was granted the permanent samurai status because of his outstanding achievements in Shugakukan, and was ordered to go to study in Akizuki Domain.
In February 1869, he was granted the permanent samurai status because of his outstanding achievements in Shugakukan, and was ordered to go to study in Akizuki Domain.

sen.j: 1870年（明治3年）7月、家老から東京遊学を命ぜられる。
sen.e: In July in 1870, he was ordered by the chief retainer to study in Tokyo.
In July 1870, he was ordered by the chief retainer to study in Tokyo.
In July 1870, he was ordered by the chief retainer to study in Tokyo.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）1月、元昌平黌中博士で松山藩大参事・藤野正啓の漢学塾に所属。
sen.e: In January 1871, he belonged to a private school of Chinese classics by Masahira FUJINO, former professor of Shoheiko (Shohei School) and the Daisanji (second to a governor) of Matsuyama domain.
In January 1871, he was admitted to a private school of Chinese classics run by Masahira FUJINO, Daisanji (second to a governor) of Matsuyama domain and former professor of Shoheiko (Shohei School).
sen.cmt: 表現変更中博士:訳不明
sen.e: In January 1871, he was admitted to a private school of Chinese classics run by Masahira FUJINO, Daisanji (second to a governor) of Matsuyama domain and former professor of Shoheiko (Shohei School).

sen.j: 同年11月、岩倉具視欧米使節団に同行した藩主黒田長知の随行員となり、アメリカ留学。
sen.e: In November of the same year, he became a follower of the Feudal Lord Nagatomo KURODA, who joined the Tomomi IWAKURA Mission of Europe and America, and studied in America.
In November of the same year, he became a retinue of Feudal Lord Nagatomo KURODA, who joined the Tomomi IWAKURA Mission to Europe and the US, and went to study in the US.
In November of the same year, he became a retinue of Feudal Lord Nagatomo KURODA, who joined the Tomomi IWAKURA Mission to Europe and the US, and went to study in the US.

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）2月、ハーバード大学入学準備に入る。
sen.e: In February 1876, he started to prepare to enter Harvard University.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In February 1876, he started preparations to be admitted to Harvard University.
In February of 1876, he began preparations to enter Harvard University.

sen.j: 弁護士オリヴァー・ウェンデル・ホームズ(後にハーバード大学教授、マサチュウセッツ州最高裁判事、その後、連邦最高裁判事)に師事し、ヘンリー・スイフトとラスル・クレイの共同法律事務所に通い勉強する。
sen.e: He studied under lawyer Oliver Wendell Holmes (later a professor of Harvard university and the Supreme Court justice of Massachusetts State, then the Associate Justice) and went to the law firm of Henry Swift and Russell Clay to study.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。人名のスペルは憶測です
sen.e: He studied under lawyer Oliver Wendell Holmes (later a professor of Harvard university and the Supreme Court justice of Massachusetts State, then the Associate Justice) and also worked for study in a law firm run jointly by Henry Swift and Russell Clay.
sen.cmt: 表現変更人名のスペル確認できませんでした
sen.e: He studied under lawyer Oliver Wendell Holmes (later a professor of Harvard university and the Supreme Court justice of Massachusetts State, then the Associate Justice) and also worked for study in a law firm run jointly by Henry Swift and Russell Clay.

sen.j: 同年10月、ハーバード大学入学（1878年（明治11年）6月卒業）。
sen.e: October of the same year, he entered Harvard University and graduated in June 1878.
He entered Harvard University in October of the same year and graduated in June 1878.
He entered Harvard University in October of the same year and graduated in June 1878.

sen.j: 同じハーバード大学に入学した小村寿太郎と同宿し勉学に励むとともに、この頃、学外では著名な政治家、議員、文学者、哲学者、ジャーナリストと交際。
sen.e: While he lodged in the same place as Jutaro KOMURA, who entered Harvard University, and studied hard, he also associates with well-known politicians, congresspeople, writers, philosophers and journalists off campus.

He shared loggings and worked hard with Jutaro KOMURA, a fellow student at University, and he also associates with well-known politicians, congress people, writers, philosophers and journalists off campus.

He shared loggings and worked hard with Jutaro KOMURA, a fellow student at University, and he also associates with well-known politicians, congress people, writers, philosophers and journalists off campus.

sen.j: また留学生仲間の伊沢修二とともに日本人として初めて電話を使っている。
sen.e: Moreover, he and Shuji IZAWA, who also studied in America, were the first Japanese who used telephone.
He talked on a telephone with Shuji IZAWA, who also studied in the US via telephone; they are the first Japanese telephone users.
He spoke by telephone with Shuji IZAWA, who was also a foreign exchange student; they are the first Japanese in history to use telephones.

sen.j: 1878年（明治11年）6月、ハーバード大学卒業。
sen.e: In June 1878, he graduated from Harvard University.
In June 1878, he graduated from Harvard University.
In June 1878, he graduated from Harvard University.

sen.j: 学士 (法学)の学位受領。
sen.e: He received a bachelor degree in law.
He received a bachelor degree in law.
He received a bachelor degree in law.

sen.j: 同年9月、帰国。
sen.e: In September of the same year, he came back to Japan.
In September of the same year, he came back to Japan.
In September of the same year, he came back to Japan.

sen.j: 都市民権政社の社員となる。
sen.e: He became a member of Toshiminkenseisha.
He became a member of Toshiminkenseisha.
He became a member of Toshiminkenseisha.

sen.j: 同年12月、東京大学予備門英語教員。
sen.e: In December of the same year, he became an English teacher in Preparatory School of the University of Tokyo (Tokyo Yobimon).
In December of the same year, he became an English teacher in Preparatory School of the University of Tokyo (Tokyo Yobimon).
In December of the same year, he became an English teacher in Preparatory School of the University of Tokyo (Tokyo Yobimon).

sen.j: この頃、共存同衆や嚶鳴社に所属し、英米法制度に関する論文作成、陪審員制度の提案、憲法私案の作成、演説会・講演会での講演など活発に民権運動を行う。
sen.e: In those days, he belonged to Kyozondoshu and Omeisha and was actively involved in civil rights movement, such as writing about the Anglo-American Law system, proposing of a juror system, drafting proposal constitution and speechmaking at speech meetings and lecture meetings.

In those days, he belonged to Kyozondoshu and Omeisha and was actively involved in civil rights movement; he wrote a paper about the Anglo-American legal system, proposed the juror system, drew up his own personal draft of the constitution, and made speeches at speech and lecture meetings.

In those days, he belonged to Kyozondoshu and Omeisha and was actively involved in the civil rights movement; he wrote a paper about the Anglo-American legal system, proposed the adoption of the juror system, drew up a draft constitution, and made speeches at both oratorical and lecture meetings.

sen.j: 1880年（明治13年）1月、嚶鳴社の同志・河津祐之元老院書記官・沼間守一元老院権大書記官の紹介で元老院に雇われる。
sen.e: In January 1880, he was employed at Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) by the recommenadation from comrades of Omeisha, Sukeyuki KAWAZU, secretary of Genroin and Morikazu NUMA, former senior secretary of Genroin.
sen.cmt: http://kotobank.jp/word/沼間守一権大書記官:訳不明
sen.e: In January 1880, he was employed at Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) through the introduction of fellow members of Omeisha--Sukeyuki KAWAZU, secretary of Genroin, and Morikazu NUMA, former senior secretary of Genroin.

In January 1880, he was employed at Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) through the introduction of fellow members of Omeisha--Sukeyuki KAWAZU, secretary of Genroin, and Morikazu NUMA, former senior secretary of Genroin.

sen.j: 同年4月、元老院権少書記官となる。
sen.e: He became a lower-ranked secretary of Genroin in April of the same year.
He became a lower-ranked secretary of Genroin in April of the same year.
He became a lower-ranked secretary of Genroin in April of the same year.

sen.j: この頃、元老院副議長佐々木高行に勧められ、エドマンド・バークを中心とした保守政治理論をまとめ『政治論略』を著す。
sen.e: In those days, he wrote "Seijigairon," which was about conservative politics theory focusing on Edmund Burke with Genroin Vice-chairman Takayuki SASAKI's encouragement.

In those days, he was encouraged by Genroin Vice-chairman Takayuki SASAKI's.to outline the theories of conservative politics mainly on Edmund Burke's theory into a book titled "Seijigairon" (outline of politics).

In those days, he was encouraged by Genroin Vice-chairman Takayuki SASAKI's.to outline the theories of conservative politics mainly on Edmund Burke's theory into a book titled "Seijigairon" (outline of politics).

sen.j: 同年11月、青森県令山田秀典の次女弥寿子と結婚。
sen.e: In November of the same year, he married Toshiko, the second daughter of Aomori prefectural governor Shusuke YAMADA.
In November of the same year, he married Toshiko, the second daughter of Aomori prefectural governor Shusuke YAMADA.
In November of the same year, he married Toshiko, the second daughter of Aomori prefectural governor Shusuke YAMADA.

sen.j: また、1880年9月に創立した専修学校（現在の専修大学）の設立に携わった。
sen.e: Moreover, he was engaged in establishment of the Senshu School (Senshu University at present) founded in September 1880.
He also got involved in the establishment of Senshu School (Present-day Senshu University), which was founded in September 1880.
He also got involved in the establishment of Senshu School (Present-day Senshu University), which was founded in September 1880.

sen.j: 目賀田種太郎や相馬永胤と同じくアメリカに留学し、ハーバードで法律を学んた。
sen.e: He studied in America like Tanetaro MEGATA and Nagatane SOMA and studied law at Harvard.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He went to the US to study law at Harvard., like Tanetaro MEGATA and Nagatane SOMA.
He went to the US to study law at Harvard., like Tanetaro MEGATA and Nagatane SOMA.

sen.j: 帰国後、専修学校の立案・運営に深く参画した。
sen.e: He was deeply involved in planning and administration of Senshu School after he returned to Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: He got deeply involved in founding and running Senshu School after returning to Japan.
He got deeply involved in founding and running Senshu School after returning to Japan.

sen.j: 1881年（明治13年）開拓使官有物払下げ事件、明治十四年の政変に関与
sen.e: He was involved in the Hokkaido Development Commissioner-owned object disposal case in 1881 and Meiji juyonen no seihen (the failed Meiji-14 coup of 1881).
He was involved in Hokkaido colonization assets scandal in 1881 and Meiji juyonen no seihen (the failed Meiji-14 coup of 1881).
He was involved in Hokkaido colonization assets scandal in 1881 and Meiji juyonen no seihen (the failed Meiji-14 coup of 1881).

sen.j: 1882年（明治15年）12月、元老院権閣の総理秘書官に就任。
sen.e: In December 1882, he assumed the position of private secretary of the prime minister of Genroin.
In December 1882, he assumed office as Executive Secretary to the prime minister in Genroin (the Chamber of Elders).
sen.cmt: 権閣のは、調べられませんでした。総理秘書官の訳を現在の英文にしました。http://www.cas.go.jp/jp/gaiyou/eibun/index.html
sen.e: In December 1882, he assumed office as Executive Secretary to the prime minister in Genroin (the Chamber of Elders).

sen.j: 大書記官に昇格。
sen.e: He was promoted to major secretary.
He was promoted to Senior Executive Secretary.
sen.cmt: 大書記官は上の訳に合せて変えました。定訳不明
sen.e: He was promoted to Senior Executive Secretary.

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）4月、太政官権大書記官兼元老院権大書記官、制度取調局御用掛。
sen.e: In April 1884, he became daijokan (grand council of state), major secretary of Genroin and Goyo-gakari of Bureau of Institutional Investigation.

In April 1884, he assumed concurrently Daijokan (Grand Council of State), Senior Executive Secretary of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders), and Goyo-gakari (a general affairs official) of Bureau of Institutional Investigation.
sen.cmt: 表現変更制度取調局の定訳調べられませんでした。
sen.e: In April 1884, he assumed concurrently Daijokan (Grand Council of State), Senior Executive Secretary of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders), and Goyo-gakari (a general affairs official) of Bureau of Institutional Investigation.

sen.j: 1885年（明治18年）北海道視察の後、開拓に関する建白書を政府に建議。
sen.e: In 1885, he proposed the petition about the exploitation to the government after he visited Hokkaido.
In 1885, he visited Hokkaido and proposed a petition about its reclamation.
In 1885, he visited Hokkaido and proposed a petition about its reclamation.

sen.j: 12月、内閣総理大臣秘書官。
sen.e: In December, he became an executive secretary to the Prime Minister.
In December, he became an Executive Secretary to the Prime Minister.
In December, he became an Executive Secretary to the Prime Minister.

sen.j: 1886年（明治19年）5月、伊藤博文内閣総理大臣のもとで井上毅、伊東巳代治らとともに憲法・皇室典範、諸法典の起草にあたる。
sen.e: In May 1886, with Kowashi INOUE, Miyoji ITO et al., he was in charge of drafting of the constitution and the Imperial House Act, and various codes under Prime Minister Hirobumi ITO.
In May 1886, he worked with INOUE, Miyoji ITO et al., to draft the constitution and the Imperial House Act, and legal codes under Prime Minister Hirobumi ITO.
In May 1886, he worked with INOUE, Miyoji ITO et al., to draft the constitution and the Imperial House Act, and legal codes under Prime Minister Hirobumi ITO.

sen.j: 1888年（明治21年）4月、枢密院書記官兼議長秘書。
sen.e: In April 1888, he became a secretary of Privy Council and private secretary of the chairperson.
In April 1888, he became the Executive Secretary and concurrently served as a secretary of the Chairman in the Privy Council
In April 1888, he became the Executive Secretary and concurrently served as a secretary of the Chairman in the Privy Council

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）7月、欧米諸国視察。
sen.e: In 1889, he visited western countries.
In July 1889, he made an official visit to western countries
In July 1889, he made an official visit to western countries

sen.j: 日本法律学校（日本大学の前身）初代校長就任（1893年（明治26年）辞任）。
sen.e: He became the first head of Nihon Law School (currently Nihon University) (he resigned in 1893).
sen.cmt: サイトを参照して日本法律学校に変更
sen.e: He became the first head of Nihon Law School (currently Nihon University) (and resigned in 1893).
He became the first head of Nihon Law School (currently Nihon University) (and resigned in 1893).
He came back to Japan in 1890.
In June 1890, he came back to Japan.
In June 1890, he came back to Japan.

sen.j: 10月、貴族院議員、初代貴族院書記官長。
sen.e: In October, he became a member of Kizokuin (the House of Peers) and the first chief secretary of the house.
In October, he became a member of Kizokuin (the House of Peers) and the first Chief Executive Secretary of the house.
In October, he became a member of Kizokuin (the House of Peers) and the first Chief Executive Secretary of the house.

sen.j: 1892年（明治25年）6月、国際公法学会会員としてスイス・ジュネーブでの国際会議に出席。
sen.e: In June 1892, he attended the international conference in Geneva, Switzerland as a member International Public Law Society.
sen.cmt: 国際公法学会：定訳不明
sen.e: In June 1892, he attended the international conference in Geneva, Switzerland as a member of International Public Law Society.
In June 1892, he attended the international conference in Geneva, Switzerland as a member of International Public Law Society.

sen.j: その後、アメリカへ立ち寄り、同年11月帰国。
sen.e: Then, he stopped by America and came back in November of the same year.
On his way home, he visited the US and came back in November of the same year.
On his way home, he visited the US and came back in November of the same year.

sen.j: 1894年（明治27年）1月、第二次伊藤博文内閣・農商務次官就任。
sen.e: In January 1894, he assumed the position of undersecretary of Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce at Hirobumi ITO's second-term cabinet.
In January 1894, he assumed the position of undersecretary of Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce of the second Hirobumi ITO Cabinet.
In January 1894, he assumed the position of undersecretary of Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce of the second Hirobumi ITO Cabinet.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）4月、第三次伊藤博文内閣・農商務大臣就任。
sen.e: In April 1898, he assumed the position of the Minister of Agriculture and Commerce at Hirobumi ITO's third-term cabinet.
In April 1898, he assumed the position of the Minister of Agriculture and Commerce of the third Hirobumi ITO' Cabinet.
In April 1898, he assumed the position of the Minister of Agriculture and Commerce of the third Hirobumi ITO' Cabinet.

sen.j: 1899年（明治32年）5月、渡米し、ハーバード大学から憲法制定等の功績により名誉法学博士号(L.L.D)を受ける。
sen.e: In May 1899, he visited America and received an honorable Doctor of Laws (L.L.D) from Harvard University for distinguished services, such as establishment of constitution.
In May 1899, he visited the US and received an Honorary Doctor of Laws degree (LLD) from Harvard University for distinguished services, such as the establishment of the Constitution.
In May 1899, he visited the US and received an Honorary Doctor of Laws degree (LLD) from Harvard University for distinguished services, such as the establishment of the Constitution.

sen.j: 同年7月帰国。
sen.e: In July of the same year, he returned to Japan.
In July of the same year, he returned to Japan.
In July of the same year, he returned to Japan.

sen.j: 帰国後、渡米中に調査したことをまとめて「トラストの利害」「米国経済と日本興業銀行」等を発表。
sen.e: After the return, he released "Interests of Trust", "U.S. Economy and Industrial Bank of Japan," based on the investigation during his visit to America.
After the return, he released "Interests of Trust," "U.S. Economy and Industrial Bank of Japan," based on the findings of his investigations during his visit to the US.
sen.cmt: 「トラストの利害」訳不明句読点
sen.e: After the return, he released "Interests of Trust," "U.S. Economy and Industrial Bank of Japan," based on the findings of his investigations during his visit to the US.

sen.j: 東京株式取引所理事長に就任。
sen.e: He assumed the position of the chief director of Tokyo stock exchange.
He assumed the position of the chief director of Tokyo Stock Exchange.
He assumed the position of the chief director of Tokyo Stock Exchange.

sen.j: 1900年（明治33年）5月、憲法制定の功績により男爵となる。
sen.e: In May 1900, he became a baron for distinguished services in constitution establishment.
In May 1900, he was granted a baron for his distinguished contributions to the establishment of the Constitution.
In May 1900, he was granted a baron for his distinguished contributions to the establishment of the Constitution.

sen.j: 10月、第四次伊藤博文内閣・司法大臣就任。
sen.e: In October, he assumed the position of the Minister of Justice at Hirobumi ITO's fourth-term cabinet.
In October, he assumed the position of the Minister of Justice of the fourth Hirobumi ITO Cabinet.
In October, he assumed the position of the Minister of Justice of the fourth Hirobumi ITO Cabinet.

sen.j: 米友協会会長に就任。
sen.e: He became the president of American Friends Association.
He became the president of American Friends Association.
He became the president of American Friends Association.

sen.j: 1904年（明治37年）2月、渡米し、日露戦争についてセオドア・ルーズベルト大統領（ハーバード大学時代の学友）と交渉（翌年10月帰国）。
sen.e: In February 1904, he visited America and negotiated with President Theodore Roosevelt (his schoolmate at Harvard University) about the Russo-Japanese War (he returned to Japan in October of the following year).

In February 1904, he visited the US and had diplomatic talks with President Theodore Roosevelt (who had been contemporarily at Harvard University) about the Russo-Japanese War (and returned to Japan in October of the following year).

In February 1904, he visited the US and had diplomatic talks with President Theodore Roosevelt (who had been contemporarily at Harvard University) about the Russo-Japanese War (and returned to Japan in October of the following year).

sen.j: 1906年（明治39年）1月、枢密顧問官。
sen.e: In January 1906, he became a privy councilor.
In January 1906, he became a privy councilor.
In January 1906, he became a privy councilor.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）子爵。
sen.e: In 1907, he became a viscount.
In 1907, he became a viscount.
In 1907, he became a viscount.

sen.j: 日本大博覧会会長、日本速記会会長に就任。
sen.e: He assumed the position of the president of Japanese Exhibition president and Japanese Stenography Association.
sen.cmt: 日本大博覧会会長、日本速記会会長:定訳不明
sen.e: He assumed the position of the Presidents of Japan World Exhibition and Japanese Stenography Association.
sen.cmt: 日本大博覧会、定訳不明ですがこちらの方が近いと思われます。
sen.e: He assumed the position of the Presidents of Japan World Exhibition and Japanese Stenography Association.

sen.j: 1908年（明治41年）語学協会総裁、東京大博覧会会長に就任。
sen.e: In 1908, he assumed the position of the president of Linguistic Association and Tokyo Exhibition.
sen.cmt: 語学協会総裁、東京大博覧会会長:定訳不明
sen.e: In 1908, he assumed the position of the President of Linguistic Association and Tokyo Exhibition.
sen.cmt: 大文字語学協会総裁、東京大博覧会会長:定訳不明
sen.e: In 1908, he assumed the position of the President of Linguistic Association and Tokyo Exhibition.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）後の維新史編纂会の発足に関わる。
sen.e: In 1910, he was involved with inauguration of later Restoration History Compile Association.
sen.cmt: 維新史編纂会:定訳不明
sen.e: Since 1910, he was involved in inaugurating an association to compile a history of Restoration.
Since 1910, he was involved in inaugurating an association to compile a history of Restoration.

sen.j: 1914年（大正3年）臨時帝室編修局総裁。
sen.e: In 1914, he became the president of temporary Imperial Editorial Office.
sen.cmt: 帝室編纂局総裁:定訳不明
sen.e: In 1914, he became the President of temporary Imperial Editorial Office.
sen.cmt: 帝室編纂局総裁:定訳不明大文字
sen.e: In 1914, he became the President of temporary Imperial Editorial Office.

sen.j: 1915年（大正4年）「明治天皇紀」編纂局総裁、維新史料編纂会総裁。
sen.e: In 1915, he became the president of "Meiji Tenno ki" Editorial Office and Restoration History Compile Association.
In 1915, he became the President of Editorial Office for compiling "Meiji Tenno ki" and the President of an association to compile historical materials of the Restoration
sen.cmt: 「明治天皇紀」編纂局総裁、維新史料編纂会は、訳が不明ですが、こちらの方がわかりやすいと思い、変更しました。
sen.e: In 1915, he became the President of Editorial Office for compiling "Meiji Tenno ki" and the President of an association to compile historical materials of the Restoration

sen.j: 1917年（大正6年）日米協会会長就任。
sen.e: In 1917, he assumed the post of chairman of The America-Japan Society.
In 1917, he assumed the post of the President of America-Japan Society.
In 1917, he assumed the post of the President of America-Japan Society.

sen.j: 1922年（大正11年）帝室編纂局総裁。
sen.e: In 1922, he became the president of Imperial Editorial Office.
sen.cmt: 帝室編纂局総裁:定訳不明
sen.e: In 1922, he became the President of Imperial Editorial Office.
sen.cmt: 帝室編纂局総裁:定訳不明大文字
sen.e: In 1922, he became the President of Imperial Editorial Office.

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）東京上野日本美術協会で大橋翠石百幅展の発起人として開催する
sen.e: In 1927, he held Suiseki OHASHI exhibition in the Tokyo Ueno Japan Art Association as a promoter.
He was listed as a promoter of Suiseki OHASHI Exhibition held by Japan Art Association in Ueno Tokyo in 1927.
sen.cmt: 大橋翠石百幅展訳不明日本美術協会→http://www.praemiumimperiale.org/eg/aboutus/jaahistory.html
sen.e: He was listed as a promoter of Suiseki OHASHI Exhibition held by Japan Art Association in Ueno Tokyo in 1927.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年） 11月10日、勲一等旭日桐花大綬章を受ける。
sen.e: On November 10, 1928, he received Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun, Paulownia Flowers.
On November 10, 1928, he received Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun, Paulownia Flowers.
On November 10, 1928, he received Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun, Paulownia Flowers.

sen.j: 1932年（昭和5年）二松学舎専門学校（二松學舍大学の前身）舎長に就任。
sen.e: In 1932, he became the principal of Nishogakusha school (later Nishogakusha University).
In 1932, he became the principal of Nishogakusha school (later Nishogakusha University).
In 1932, he became the principal of Nishogakusha school (later Nishogakusha University).

sen.j: 1938年（昭和13年）前年の「明治天皇紀」完成の功により伯爵に昇爵。
sen.e: In 1938, he became a count for the previous year's completion of "Meiji Tenno ki."
In 1938, he was awarded a higher title of Hakushaku (count) for his services to "Meiji Tenno ki,." which had been completed in the previous year.
In 1938, he was awarded a higher title of Hakushaku (count) for his services to "Meiji Tenno ki,." which had been completed in the previous year.

sen.j: 賀川豊彦（社会運動家）・松田竹千代（立憲民政党代議士。戦後、衆議院議長）・三木武夫（代議士。戦後、首相）らとともに「日米同志会」を立ち上げて会長となる。
sen.e: With Toyohiko KAGAWA (campaigner), Takechiyo MATSUDA (parliamentarian of Rikken Minsei-to political party, chairman of House of Representatives after the war), Takeo MIKI (parliamentarian, Prime Minister after the war), et al., he founded "Japan-U.S. Fellow Association" and became the chairman.

He worked with Toyohiko KAGAWA (engaged in a social movement), Takechiyo MATSUDA (a parliamentarian of Rikken Minsei-to political party, who became the Chairman of House of Representatives after the Second World War), Takeo MIKI (a parliamentarian who became the Prime Minister after the Second World War), etc. to found "Japan-U.S. Fellow Association," and he became the first chairman.
sen.cmt: 表現変更日米同志会:定訳不明
sen.e: He worked with Toyohiko KAGAWA (engaged in a social movement), Takechiyo MATSUDA (a parliamentarian of Rikken Minsei-to political party, who became the Chairman of House of Representatives after the Second World War), Takeo MIKI (a parliamentarian who became the Prime Minister after the Second World War), etc. to found "Japan-U.S. Fellow Association," and he became the first chairman.

sen.j: 1941年（昭和16年）「維新史」奉呈。
sen.e: He presented "Ishinshi" in 1941.
IN 1941, he presented "Ishinshi" to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 奉呈とは、天皇に差し上げたと解釈しました。
sen.e: IN 1941, he presented "Ishinshi" to the Emperor.

sen.j: 朝河貫一から日米開戦の回避を求める書簡が送られる。
sen.e: He received a letter from Kanichi ASAKAWA, seeking for evasion of outbreak of war between Japan and the United States.
He received a letter from Kanichi ASAKAWA wishing to avoid an outbreak of war between Japan and the United States.
He received a letter from Kanichi ASAKAWA wishing to avoid an outbreak of war between Japan and the United States.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）5月16日、永眠（89歳）、従一位大勲位菊花大綬章。
sen.e: May 16, 1942, he passed away (at the age of 89) and received Juichii (Junior First Rank) and Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
May 16, 1942, he passed away (at the age of 89) and was awarded Juichii (Junior First Rank) and Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
May 16, 1942, he passed away (at the age of 89) and was awarded Juichii (Junior First Rank) and Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
